item.title: PHP Development in Eclipse Has Never been Easier!

item.description:
Great news for you, PHP developer: your coding experience in Eclipse just got better thanks to CodeMix! It’s an Eclipse plugin that gives you access to a whole array of technologies from VS Code and add-on extensions built for Code OSS.How does CodeMix handle PHP support? Directly from Code OSS! item.title: MyEclipse 2018 – Where Art Thou?
item.dc:creator: Brian Fernandes
item.description:
MyEclipse 2017 was first released in January 2017, and its most recent release, 2017 CI 10, was in December 2017. We will probably have a couple additional 2017 releases to round off that stream as well … so where’s MyEclipse 2018?The short answer – MyEclipse 2018 is coming in May, with one game-changing addition, CodeMix! item.title: CodeMix – A Genesis
item.dc:creator: timwebb
item.description:
What if we could give Eclipse developers access to the rich catalog of VS Code extensions and advanced development that Code offers? And that’s when CodeMix was born. By providing VS Code smarts inside Eclipse, we no longer have to play catch-up, and our customers can realize the benefits and combined effect Code & Eclipse provide with all the great advances in the technology world.

The post CodeMix – A Genesis appeared first on Genuitec.

item.title: Angular Observables and Promises – How to Use Them

item.description:

item.title: Angular 5 Authentication: Getting Started
item.dc:creator: Bob at Genuitec
item.description:
In this tutorial, we are going to build an Angular 5 authentication system using Google’s Cloud Firestore. Most of the applications we build require some kind of authentication, and the simplest and fastest way to get started with that is by using the Firestore – a flexible, scalable database for mobile, web and server development. item.title: Creating Twitter Clone Using HTML, CSS, jQuery
item.dc:creator: Bob at Genuitec
item.description:
In this project, we are going to create a Twitter clone using HTML, CSS and jQuery only. We will create the Registration screen and Twitter wall, where you can post tweets up to 250 characters in length. You can also retweet and like the tweets. However, since we are not using any server and database, […]
